choices: If the symbolic power of I is equal to the third power of I.
If the symbolic power of I is a subset of the saturation of the third power of I.
If the symbolic power of I is equal to the saturation of the third power of I.
If the saturation of the third power of I is a subset of the symbolic power of I.

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of ideal is being analyzed in this example?
What is the output of the command `symbolicPower(I,2)`?
What does the theorem state about the relationship between the symbolic power and ordinary power of an ideal *I* in a regular ring *R*?
choices: The symbolic power of *I* is always equal to the ordinary power of *I*.
The symbolic power of *I* is a subset of the ordinary power of *I* if and only if the height of *I* is one.
The symbolic power of *I* is a superset of the ordinary power of *I* if and only if the height of *I* is one.
The symbolic power of *I* is equal to the ordinary power of *I* if and only if *I* is a prime ideal.
